skill.name: vite
skill.description: Agent guidance for configuring Vite, using the CLI, and applying core features, plugins, and build modes based on the bundled references.
skill.summary: Guides agents to use Vite configuration, CLI, and build features.
skill.author: antfu

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged command usage, URLs, environment variables, scripts, and filesystem access, but these appear only in documentation examples. No evidence of credential exfiltration, malicious logic, or prompt injection was found. Risk is low and mainly reflects instructional content.

low_findings.title: Shell command examples in documentation
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.33. Confidence reasoning: Command lines appear in fenced code blocks as usage examples, so they are not executed by the skill itself.

low_findings.title: Environment variable examples in docs
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.34. Confidence reasoning: Examples show how Vite exposes prefixed variables; there is no code reading real secrets in the skill files.

low_findings.title: Dynamic import and filesystem examples
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.32. Confidence reasoning: Dynamic import and fs calls appear in SSR examples to explain Vite behavior, not to execute hidden actions.

dangerous_patterns.title: Command usage examples
dangerous_patterns.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.33. Confidence reasoning: The skill references CLI commands as documentation, which do not run automatically.

dangerous_patterns.title: Dynamic import patterns in documentation
dangerous_patterns.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.31. Confidence reasoning: The dynamic import example illustrates Vite limitations and does not process untrusted input in this skill.

content.user_title: Configure Vite projects with verified patterns
content.value_statement: Teams need accurate guidance for Vite configuration and build workflows. This skill summarizes official patterns and examples so agents can propose correct settings and commands.
actual_capabilities: Explain Vite config structure and mode based configuration patterns.
Provide CLI command examples for dev, build, and preview tasks.
Describe plugin ordering and common plugin hook usage.
Summarize asset, CSS, and dependency pre bundling behavior.
Outline SSR and library build configuration options.
limitations: Does not run Vite or execute builds.
Does not validate plugin code or project specific files.
Examples may require adaptation to a specific framework.
Cannot access private repositories or environment files.

use_cases.title: Set up a new Vite config
use_cases.description: Draft a base configuration with mode specific settings and essential plugins.

use_cases.title: Diagnose build options
use_cases.description: List build flags and explain their effects on output size and performance.

use_cases.title: Plan SSR integration
use_cases.description: Outline SSR entry points, server integration steps, and build outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Create a minimal Vite config
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a minimal Vite configuration for a new project. Include base, server port, and a simple alias.

prompt_templates.title: Add plugins and mode handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Update this Vite config to enable a plugin and separate dev and production settings. Explain why the order matters.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize production build
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend build options for smaller bundles and faster caching. Note tradeoffs for source maps and minifiers.

prompt_templates.title: Design an SSR build pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline an SSR build pipeline with server entry, client entry, and asset handling. Call out required Vite APIs.

output_examples.input: Explain how to expose environment variables safely in Vite.
output_examples.output: Use VITE_ prefixed variables for client exposure, keep secrets unprefixed, and document the expected keys in a shared list.

output_examples.input: Provide a checklist for a production build review.
output: Confirm build target and minifier selection.
Verify output directories and asset paths.
Check source map settings and deployment needs.

best_practices: Scope configuration by mode and keep defaults unless there is a clear requirement.
Use official plugin hooks and keep plugin ordering explicit.
Document environment variables and expose only prefixed keys.
anti_patterns: Exposing secret environment variables to client bundles.
Adding plugins without verifying compatibility or ordering.
Overriding base paths without updating asset references.

faq.question: Does this skill run Vite commands for me?
faq.answer: No. It provides guidance and examples, but it does not execute commands.

faq.question: Can it generate a full Vite config file?
faq.answer: It can draft configuration suggestions, but you must integrate them into your project.

faq.question: Does it support framework specific templates?
faq.answer: It references common Vite patterns, but framework details need manual verification.

faq.question: Will it handle secrets or environment files?
faq.answer: No. It only explains safe exposure patterns and does not access real secrets.

faq.question: Can it help with SSR setup?
faq.answer: Yes, it outlines SSR entry points and build steps based on Vite documentation.

faq.question: Is the information based on official docs?
faq.answer: Yes. The references are generated from the project documentation.
